system idle process.description: Shows how much of your CPU is doing nothing. It's not actually using resources — high CPU here means your system is idle.
system idle process.kill_impact: DO NOT KILL — This is the CPU idle counter, not a real process.
system idle process.kill_warning: Cannot be terminated. This represents idle CPU time.

system.exe.description: The Windows kernel itself — the core brain of your operating system that manages everything.
system.exe.kill_impact: DO NOT KILL — Instant blue screen crash (BSOD). Your PC will reboot.
system.exe.kill_warning: This is the core Windows kernel process. Terminating it will cause an immediate blue screen.

system.description: The Windows kernel itself — the core brain of your operating system that manages everything.
system.kill_impact: DO NOT KILL — Instant blue screen crash (BSOD). Your PC will reboot.
system.kill_warning: This is the core Windows kernel process. Terminating it will cause an immediate blue screen.

registry.description: Handles the Windows Registry — the central database that stores all system and app settings.
registry.kill_impact: DO NOT KILL — Could corrupt your system settings and crash Windows.
registry.kill_warning: Manages the Windows registry. Do not terminate.

smss.exe.description: Session Manager — starts up your Windows sessions when you log in. Runs very early in the boot process.
smss.exe.kill_impact: DO NOT KILL — Will crash Windows immediately.
smss.exe.kill_warning: Manages Windows session creation. Killing this will crash the system.

csrss.exe.description: Core Windows process that manages console windows (like Command Prompt) and creates threads for other programs.
csrss.exe.kill_impact: DO NOT KILL — Instant blue screen (BSOD). Windows cannot run without this.
csrss.exe.kill_warning: Core Windows subsystem process. Terminating it will cause a blue screen of death.

wininit.exe.description: Runs once at startup to launch critical services like the Service Control Manager and Local Security Authority.
wininit.exe.kill_impact: DO NOT KILL — Will crash the operating system.
wininit.exe.kill_warning: Initializes the Windows environment. Cannot be safely terminated.

winlogon.exe.description: Handles your login screen, Ctrl+Alt+Del, and switching between users. Always running while you're logged in.
winlogon.exe.kill_impact: DO NOT KILL — You'll be locked out of your session. Screen may go black.
winlogon.exe.kill_warning: Manages user authentication. Killing this will lock you out of your session.

services.exe.description: The master controller for all Windows services (background programs like networking, printing, updates, etc.).
services.exe.kill_impact: DO NOT KILL — All Windows services will stop. System will crash.
services.exe.kill_warning: Controls all Windows services. Terminating will crash the operating system.

lsass.exe.description: Handles all login security — checks your passwords, manages encryption, and enforces security policies.
lsass.exe.kill_impact: DO NOT KILL — Forces an immediate restart. All users will be logged out.
lsass.exe.kill_warning: Handles all security authentication. Killing this forces an immediate restart.

lsaiso.exe.description: A secure vault for your login credentials, running in an isolated container so malware can't steal passwords.
lsaiso.exe.kill_impact: DO NOT KILL — Breaks Credential Guard security protection.
lsaiso.exe.kill_warning: Protects credentials in a virtualized container. Do not terminate.

dwm.exe.description: Desktop Window Manager — draws everything you see on screen: windows, transparency, animations, and visual effects.
dwm.exe.kill_impact: DO NOT KILL — Screen goes black. Desktop restarts automatically but you'll lose window positions.
dwm.exe.kill_warning: Renders the entire desktop. Killing it will cause the screen to go black and restart the shell.

fontdrvhost.exe.description: Renders all the fonts (text) you see on screen. Runs in a sandbox for security.
fontdrvhost.exe.kill_impact: DO NOT KILL — Text may become unreadable or display may break.
fontdrvhost.exe.kill_warning: Handles font rendering. Terminating may cause display issues.

ntoskrnl.exe.description: The actual Windows kernel file — handles memory, hardware, and everything at the deepest level of the OS.
ntoskrnl.exe.kill_impact: DO NOT KILL — This IS Windows. Cannot be terminated.
ntoskrnl.exe.kill_warning: This IS the Windows kernel. Cannot be terminated.

memory compression.description: Squeezes data in RAM to fit more in memory, so Windows doesn't have to use the slower hard drive as much.
memory compression.kill_impact: DO NOT KILL — System memory management will break.
memory compression.kill_warning: System memory management process. Cannot be terminated.

trustedinstaller.exe.description: Installs Windows updates and system components. Only runs when updates are being applied.
trustedinstaller.exe.kill_impact: DO NOT KILL — Can corrupt Windows Update and leave your system in a broken state.
trustedinstaller.exe.kill_warning: Installs system updates. Interrupting may corrupt Windows Update.

svchost.exe.description: A container that runs one or more Windows services. Many copies run at once, each hosting different services.
svchost.exe.kill_impact: RISKY — Each svchost hosts different services. Killing the wrong one can break networking, audio, or updates.
svchost.exe.kill_warning: Hosts one or more Windows services. Check which services it hosts before terminating.

service_descriptions.wuauserv: Windows Update — Downloads and installs system updates
service_descriptions.bits: Background file downloader — Used by Windows Update to download files
service_descriptions.dnscache: DNS Client — Remembers website addresses so browsing is faster
service_descriptions.audiosrv: Audio Service — Makes your speakers and headphones work
service_descriptions.audioendpointbuilder: Audio Endpoint Builder — Detects and sets up audio devices
service_descriptions.lanmanserver: File Sharing — Lets other computers access your shared folders
service_descriptions.lanmanworkstation: Network Client — Connects you to shared folders on other computers
service_descriptions.schedule: Task Scheduler — Runs programs at scheduled times (backups, updates, etc.)
service_descriptions.eventlog: Event Logger — Records system events for troubleshooting
service_descriptions.plugplay: Plug and Play — Detects when you plug in new hardware (USB, etc.)
service_descriptions.power: Power Manager — Handles sleep, hibernate, and battery settings
service_descriptions.spooler: Print Spooler — Manages your print jobs
service_descriptions.themes: Themes Service — Makes your desktop look pretty (colors, wallpaper, etc.)
service_descriptions.winmgmt: WMI Service — Lets programs query system info (used by many tools)
service_descriptions.cryptsvc: Crypto Service — Manages security certificates and code signing
service_descriptions.netprofm: Network List — Identifies which network you're connected to
service_descriptions.nsi: Network Store — Keeps track of network configuration
service_descriptions.dhcp: DHCP Client — Gets your computer's IP address automatically
service_descriptions.mpssvc: Windows Firewall — Blocks unauthorized network connections
service_descriptions.bfe: Firewall Engine — The core engine behind Windows Firewall
service_descriptions.diagtrack: Telemetry — Sends diagnostic data to Microsoft (can be disabled in Settings)
service_descriptions.dosvc: Delivery Optimization — Downloads updates from nearby PCs to save bandwidth
service_descriptions.sysmain: SysMain (Superfetch) — Pre-loads apps you use often so they open faster
service_descriptions.wlansvc: Wi-Fi Service — Manages your wireless network connections
service_descriptions.netman: Network Manager — Manages all your network connections
service_descriptions.iphlpsvc: IP Helper — Handles IPv6 and network tunneling
service_descriptions.pcasvc: Compatibility Assistant — Helps old programs run on new Windows
service_descriptions.shellhwdetection: AutoPlay — Pops up options when you insert USB drives or discs
service_descriptions.usosvc: Update Orchestrator — Manages the timing and scheduling of Windows Updates
service_descriptions.wpnservice: Push Notifications — Delivers notifications from Windows and apps
service_descriptions.camsvc: Permission Manager — Controls which apps can use your camera, microphone, etc.
service_descriptions.cbdhsvc: Clipboard Sync — Syncs your clipboard between devices
service_descriptions.dps: Diagnostic Service — Automatically diagnoses common Windows problems
service_descriptions.storagesvc: Storage Service — Manages drives and storage spaces
service_descriptions.tabletinputservice: Touch Keyboard — Provides the on-screen keyboard and handwriting input
service_descriptions.tokenbroker: Account Manager — Manages Microsoft account login tokens
service_descriptions.wersvc: Error Reporting — Sends crash reports to Microsoft
service_descriptions.wisvc: Insider Service — Manages Windows Insider Preview builds
service_descriptions.lfsvc: Location Service — Provides your location to apps that request it
service_descriptions.licensemgr: License Manager — Manages Windows and Store app licenses
service_descriptions.statesvc: State Service — Saves and restores app state (window positions, etc.)
service_descriptions.tiledatamodelsvc: Start Menu Tiles — Manages the tiles/pins on your Start menu
service_descriptions.dispbrokerdesktopsvc: Display Policy — Manages display settings and screen layout
service_descriptions.profiling: Windows Profiling — Collects performance data for optimization
service_descriptions.wecsvc: Event Collector — Gathers event logs from remote computers

explorer.exe.description: Your desktop, taskbar, Start button, and File Explorer — the main shell you interact with every day.
explorer.exe.kill_impact: CAUTION — Taskbar and desktop icons disappear. It usually auto-restarts within seconds.
explorer.exe.kill_warning: This is the Windows shell (taskbar, desktop, file explorer). Killing it removes the taskbar and desktop icons. It will auto-restart.

taskmgr.exe.description: The built-in Windows Task Manager. The one you open with Ctrl+Shift+Esc.
taskmgr.exe.kill_impact: Safe — Just closes the Task Manager window. No harm done.

sihost.exe.description: Supports the Start menu, Action Center (notifications), and other shell features behind the scenes.
sihost.exe.kill_impact: CAUTION — Start menu and notifications may stop working until restart.
sihost.exe.kill_warning: Provides shell infrastructure for the Start menu and notification area.

taskhostw.exe.description: Runs scheduled tasks and maintenance jobs in the background (like disk cleanup, defrag, etc.).
taskhostw.exe.kill_impact: CAUTION — Scheduled maintenance tasks will be interrupted. Usually auto-restarts.
taskhostw.exe.kill_warning: Executes scheduled tasks. Killing may prevent important maintenance tasks.

runtimebroker.exe.description: Permission guard for Microsoft Store apps — decides if they can access your camera, location, etc.
runtimebroker.exe.kill_impact: Safe — Store apps might glitch briefly. It restarts automatically.
runtimebroker.exe.kill_warning: Manages UWP app permissions. Will restart automatically if needed.

ctfmon.exe.description: Handles your keyboard input, language switching, and the language bar in the taskbar.
ctfmon.exe.kill_impact: Safe — Keyboard input might stop briefly. Restarts automatically.
ctfmon.exe.kill_warning: Handles text input services. Killing may affect keyboard input temporarily.

conhost.exe.description: Draws the window for Command Prompt and other console programs. One per open console window.
conhost.exe.kill_impact: Safe — Just closes that specific console window.

dllhost.exe.description: COM Surrogate — generates thumbnails for files in File Explorer and hosts certain system components.
dllhost.exe.kill_impact: Safe — File Explorer thumbnails may stop loading briefly. Restarts on its own.
dllhost.exe.kill_warning: Hosts COM components like thumbnail generators. Safe to kill but may restart.

searchhost.exe.description: Powers the Windows Search box in the taskbar. Lets you search for files, apps, and settings.
searchhost.exe.kill_impact: Safe — Search bar stops working temporarily. Restarts automatically.
searchhost.exe.kill_warning: Powers Windows Search. Killing will temporarily disable search functionality.

searchindexer.exe.description: Scans your files in the background to build a search index, so searches are fast.
searchindexer.exe.kill_impact: Safe — Search results may be slower/incomplete until it restarts and re-indexes.
searchindexer.exe.kill_warning: Indexes files for search. Killing stops indexing until service restarts.

securityhealthservice.exe.description: Monitors your system security status — checks if antivirus, firewall, and updates are working.
securityhealthservice.exe.kill_impact: CAUTION — Windows Security health monitoring stops. Won't alert you to security issues.
securityhealthservice.exe.kill_warning: Part of Windows Security. Killing disables health monitoring.

securityhealthsystray.exe.description: The little shield icon in your system tray that shows Windows Security status.
securityhealthsystray.exe.kill_impact: Safe — Just removes the shield icon from the tray. Security still works.

msmpeng.exe.description: Windows Defender antivirus engine — actively scans files and monitors for malware in real time.
msmpeng.exe.kill_impact: DANGEROUS — Real-time virus protection stops. Your PC is unprotected until it restarts.
msmpeng.exe.kill_warning: Windows Defender real-time protection. Killing leaves system unprotected.

mpcmdrun.exe.description: Windows Defender's command-line tool — runs scans and updates when triggered.
mpcmdrun.exe.kill_impact: Safe — Just stops the current scan or update check.

nissrv.exe.description: Windows Defender's network inspector — watches network traffic for threats and exploits.
nissrv.exe.kill_impact: CAUTION — Network threat detection stops. Reduces your security.
nissrv.exe.kill_warning: Network threat protection. Disabling reduces security.

smartscreen.exe.description: Checks downloaded files and websites against Microsoft's database of known threats.
smartscreen.exe.kill_impact: Safe — Download/website safety checks stop temporarily. Restarts when needed.
smartscreen.exe.kill_warning: Provides web filtering protection. Will restart when needed.

spoolsv.exe.description: Print Spooler — queues up your print jobs and sends them to your printer one at a time.
spoolsv.exe.kill_impact: CAUTION — All current print jobs are lost. Printing won't work until you restart the service.
spoolsv.exe.kill_warning: Manages printing. Killing will cancel all print jobs.

wlanext.exe.description: Wi-Fi driver helper — works with your wireless card's driver to manage Wi-Fi connections.
wlanext.exe.kill_impact: CAUTION — You may lose your Wi-Fi connection.
wlanext.exe.kill_warning: Supports Wi-Fi connectivity. Killing may disconnect Wi-Fi.

audiodg.exe.description: Audio engine — processes all sound from your speakers and headphones. Applies audio effects.
audiodg.exe.kill_impact: Safe — All sound stops immediately. Restarts automatically within seconds.
audiodg.exe.kill_warning: Processes all audio. Killing will cause audio to stop until it restarts.

wudfhost.exe.description: Runs device drivers in user mode (safer than kernel mode) — handles USB, sensors, and other hardware.
wudfhost.exe.kill_impact: CAUTION — Hardware devices (USB, sensors, etc.) may stop working.
wudfhost.exe.kill_warning: Hosts device drivers. Killing may cause hardware to stop working.

wmiprvse.exe.description: WMI Provider — answers system information queries from programs and scripts.
wmiprvse.exe.kill_impact: Safe — System management tools may glitch briefly. Restarts on demand.
wmiprvse.exe.kill_warning: Handles system management queries. Will restart on demand.

dashost.exe.description: Device pairing helper — assists with connecting Bluetooth and wireless devices.
dashost.exe.kill_impact: Safe — New device pairing won't work temporarily. Already-paired devices are fine.

msiexec.exe.description: Windows Installer — actively installing, updating, or removing software right now.
msiexec.exe.kill_impact: CAUTION — If killed during an install, the app may be left in a broken/partial state.
msiexec.exe.kill_warning: Handles software installation. Killing during install may corrupt the application.

msedge.exe.description: Microsoft Edge web browser — each tab and extension runs as a separate process.
msedge.exe.kill_impact: Safe — Closes Edge. You may lose unsaved form data in open tabs.

chrome.exe.description: Google Chrome web browser — each tab, extension, and plugin runs as its own process.
chrome.exe.kill_impact: Safe — Closes Chrome. You may lose unsaved form data. Tabs are recoverable on relaunch.

firefox.exe.description: Mozilla Firefox web browser — your tabs and browsing session.
firefox.exe.kill_impact: Safe — Closes Firefox. Session is usually restored on relaunch.

brave.exe.description: Brave browser — privacy-focused web browser based on Chromium.
brave.exe.kill_impact: Safe — Closes Brave. Tabs are recoverable on relaunch.

opera.exe.description: Opera browser — web browser with built-in VPN and ad blocker.

code.exe.description: Visual Studio Code — popular code editor by Microsoft. Used for programming.
code.exe.kill_impact: Safe — Closes VS Code. Unsaved files are usually recovered on relaunch.

devenv.exe.description: Microsoft Visual Studio — full IDE for software development (.NET, C++, etc.).
devenv.exe.kill_impact: Safe — Closes Visual Studio. Save your work first.

python.exe.description: Python program running — could be a script, server, or application written in Python.
python.exe.kill_impact: Safe — Stops the Python script. Check if it's doing something important first.

pythonw.exe.description: Python program running without a console window — often a GUI app or background script.

node.exe.description: Node.js — running a JavaScript application, usually a web server or dev tool.
node.exe.kill_impact: Safe — Stops the Node.js application. If it's a dev server, your website preview stops.

java.exe.description: Java application — could be Minecraft, an IDE, a server, or any Java-based program.
java.exe.kill_impact: Safe — Stops the Java app. Save your work in the app first.

javaw.exe.description: Java application running without a console window — often a GUI program like Minecraft or Eclipse.

notepad.exe.kill_impact: Safe — Closes Notepad. Unsaved text is lost.

notepad++.exe.description: Notepad++ — advanced text editor popular with programmers.
notepad++.exe.kill_impact: Safe — Closes Notepad++. It usually recovers unsaved tabs on relaunch.

winword.exe.description: Microsoft Word — document editor. You may have an open document with unsaved changes.
winword.exe.kill_impact: Safe — Closes Word. AutoRecover usually saves recent changes.

excel.exe.description: Microsoft Excel — spreadsheet application. May have unsaved work.
excel.exe.kill_impact: Safe — Closes Excel. AutoRecover usually saves recent changes.

powerpnt.exe.kill_impact: Safe — Closes PowerPoint. Save your presentation first.

outlook.exe.description: Microsoft Outlook — email, calendar, and contacts. May be sending or receiving mail.
outlook.exe.kill_impact: Safe — Closes Outlook. Emails being composed are saved as drafts.

teams.exe.description: Microsoft Teams — chat, video calls, and file sharing for work or school.
teams.exe.kill_impact: Safe — Ends any active calls/meetings. You'll appear offline.

slack.exe.description: Slack — team messaging and collaboration app.
slack.exe.kill_impact: Safe — You'll appear offline. Messages are saved on the server.

discord.exe.description: Discord — voice chat, text messaging, and community platform.
discord.exe.kill_impact: Safe — Disconnects from voice channels. You'll appear offline.

spotify.exe.description: Spotify — music and podcast streaming. Currently playing or running in background.
spotify.exe.kill_impact: Safe — Music stops. Reopen to resume listening.

steam.exe.description: Steam — game store, library, and launcher by Valve. Manages your game collection.
steam.exe.kill_impact: Safe — Closes Steam. Any game downloads are paused (resume on relaunch).

steamwebhelper.exe.description: Steam's built-in web browser — powers the Steam store, community, and overlay.
steamwebhelper.exe.kill_impact: Safe — Steam's browser features stop. Steam itself keeps running.

epicgameslauncher.exe.description: Epic Games Launcher — game store and library for Fortnite, etc.
epicgameslauncher.exe.kill_impact: Safe — Closes Epic Games. Downloads are paused.

vlc.exe.description: VLC Media Player — playing a video or audio file.

wmplayer.exe.description: Windows Media Player — playing media files.

snippingtool.exe.description: Snipping Tool — screenshot and screen recording utility.
snippingtool.exe.kill_impact: Safe — Current screenshot is lost if unsaved.

cmd.exe.description: Command Prompt — the classic Windows command-line interface.
cmd.exe.kill_impact: Safe — Closes the command window. Running commands are terminated.

powershell.exe.description: Windows PowerShell — advanced command-line shell for system administration.
powershell.exe.kill_impact: Safe — Closes PowerShell. Running scripts are terminated.

pwsh.exe.description: PowerShell 7+ — the modern cross-platform version of PowerShell.
pwsh.exe.kill_impact: Safe — Closes PowerShell. Running scripts are terminated.

windowsterminal.exe.description: Windows Terminal — modern terminal app that can run CMD, PowerShell, and WSL in tabs.
windowsterminal.exe.kill_impact: Safe — Closes all terminal tabs and running commands.

openssh.exe.description: OpenSSH — secure remote connection to another computer.

git.exe.description: Git — version control. Probably running a git command (pull, push, clone, etc.).
git.exe.kill_impact: Safe — The git operation stops. May leave a lock file you need to delete.

msedgewebview2.exe.description: Edge WebView2 — an embedded browser used by other apps to show web content (Teams, Widgets, etc.).
msedgewebview2.exe.kill_impact: Safe — The app using it may lose its web content display.

applicationframehost.exe.description: Hosts the window frame for Microsoft Store (UWP) apps like Calculator, Photos, Settings.
applicationframehost.exe.kill_impact: Safe — UWP apps may close. They reopen normally.

textinputhost.exe.description: Provides the touch keyboard, emoji picker (Win+.), and handwriting input panel.
textinputhost.exe.kill_impact: Safe — Emoji picker and touch keyboard stop working temporarily.

startmenuexperiencehost.exe.description: The Windows Start menu — what you see when you click the Start button.
startmenuexperiencehost.exe.kill_impact: Safe — Start menu disappears briefly, then auto-restarts.
startmenuexperiencehost.exe.kill_warning: Hosts the Start menu. It will auto-restart but Start menu will be briefly unavailable.

shellexperiencehost.exe.description: Handles the visual experience of the taskbar, Start menu, and Action Center.
shellexperiencehost.exe.kill_impact: Safe — Taskbar visuals glitch briefly, then auto-restart.
shellexperiencehost.exe.kill_warning: Handles taskbar and notification visuals. Will restart automatically.

widgets.exe.description: Windows Widgets panel — the news, weather, and widget board you access from the taskbar.
widgets.exe.kill_impact: Safe — Widgets panel closes. No important data lost.

phoneexperiencehost.exe.description: Phone Link — lets you see phone notifications, texts, and photos on your PC.
phoneexperiencehost.exe.kill_impact: Safe — Phone link features stop. Reopen the app to reconnect.

yourphone.exe.description: Phone Link (older name: Your Phone) — connects your Android phone to your PC.

gamebar.exe.description: Xbox Game Bar — the overlay you open with Win+G for screenshots, recording, and performance stats.
gamebar.exe.kill_impact: Safe — Game bar closes. No impact on games.

gamebarftserver.exe.description: Xbox Game Bar background service — supports Game Bar features.
gamebarftserver.exe.kill_impact: Safe — Game Bar features may not work until restarted.

gamingservices.exe.description: Xbox Gaming Services — supports Game Pass, achievements, and Xbox integration.
gamingservices.exe.kill_impact: Safe — Xbox features stop. Games keep running.

lockapp.exe.description: The Windows lock screen — shows clock, date, and notifications when your PC is locked.
lockapp.exe.kill_impact: Safe — Lock screen may look plain next time. Restarts automatically.

systemsettings.exe.description: Windows Settings app — where you change system preferences.
systemsettings.exe.kill_impact: Safe — Settings window closes. Unsaved changes are lost.

settingsynchost.exe.description: Syncs your Windows settings (theme, passwords, etc.) to your Microsoft account across devices.

onedrive.exe.description: Microsoft OneDrive — syncs your files to the cloud. Running in background.
onedrive.exe.kill_impact: Safe — File syncing stops. Files already on your PC are fine. Reopen to resume sync.

mspcmanager.exe.description: Microsoft PC Manager — system cleanup and optimization tool by Microsoft.

7zfm.exe.description: 7-Zip File Manager — open-source archive tool for ZIP, RAR, 7z files.

winrar.exe.description: WinRAR — archive manager for ZIP and RAR files.

obs64.exe.description: OBS Studio — screen recording and live streaming software.
obs64.exe.kill_impact: Safe — Recording/streaming stops. Current recording file may be incomplete.

gimp-2.10.exe.description: GIMP — free and open-source image editor (like Photoshop).
gimp-2.10.exe.kill_impact: Safe — Unsaved image edits are lost.

photoshop.exe.description: Adobe Photoshop — professional image editing software.
photoshop.exe.kill_impact: Safe — Unsaved edits lost. Photoshop may recover some via auto-save.

afterfx.exe.description: Adobe After Effects — motion graphics and visual effects.
afterfx.exe.kill_impact: Safe — Unsaved project changes are lost. Any render in progress stops.

premiere pro.exe.description: Adobe Premiere Pro — professional video editing software.
premiere pro.exe.kill_impact: Safe — Unsaved edits lost. Auto-save may recover some work.

acrobat.exe.description: Adobe Acrobat — PDF editor and creator.
acrobat.exe.kill_impact: Safe — Unsaved PDF edits are lost.

acrord32.exe.kill_impact: Safe — Just closes the PDF viewer.

ccxprocess.exe.description: Adobe Creative Cloud background process — manages Adobe app updates and licensing.
ccxprocess.exe.kill_impact: Safe — Adobe update checks stop. Your Adobe apps keep working.

cclibrary.exe.description: Adobe Creative Cloud Library — syncs assets (fonts, colors, etc.) across Adobe apps.
cclibrary.exe.kill_impact: Safe — Library syncing stops. Local assets still available.

adobeipcbroker.exe.description: Adobe IPC Broker — lets Adobe apps communicate with each other.
adobeipcbroker.exe.kill_impact: Safe — Cross-app Adobe features may not work until restarted.

nvidiacontainer.exe.description: NVIDIA Container — background service for your NVIDIA GPU drivers and features.
nvidiacontainer.exe.kill_impact: Safe — GPU monitoring and some NVIDIA features stop. Games keep working.
nvidiacontainer.exe.kill_warning: NVIDIA driver services. Killing may affect GPU monitoring features.

nvdisplay.container.exe.description: NVIDIA Display Container — manages display driver settings and multiple monitors.
nvdisplay.container.exe.kill_impact: Safe — Display settings may reset temporarily.

nvsphelper64.exe.description: NVIDIA 3D Vision helper — supports stereoscopic 3D (rarely used now).
nvsphelper64.exe.kill_impact: Safe — No impact unless you use 3D Vision.

nvidia share.exe.description: NVIDIA ShadowPlay/Share — game recording, instant replay, and streaming overlay.

nvidia web helper.exe.description: NVIDIA GeForce Experience web component — powers the GeForce Experience interface.
nvidia web helper.exe.kill_impact: Safe — GeForce Experience UI may not work until restarted.

amdrsserv.exe.description: AMD Radeon Software Service — background service for AMD GPU drivers.
amdrsserv.exe.kill_impact: Safe — AMD software features stop. Games keep working.

amddvr.exe.description: AMD ReLive — game recording and streaming for AMD GPUs.

razer synapse 3.exe.description: Razer Synapse — configures your Razer mouse, keyboard, and other peripherals.
razer synapse 3.exe.kill_impact: Safe — Custom keybinds/lighting revert to defaults until reopened.

icue.exe.description: Corsair iCUE — controls RGB lighting and settings for Corsair peripherals.
icue.exe.kill_impact: Safe — RGB lighting and custom settings revert to defaults.

logitechg hub.exe.description: Logitech G Hub — configures Logitech gaming mice, keyboards, and headsets.
logitechg hub.exe.kill_impact: Safe — Custom button mappings and lighting revert to defaults.

dropbox.exe.description: Dropbox — syncs your Dropbox files between your PC and the cloud.
dropbox.exe.kill_impact: Safe — File syncing stops. Local files are untouched.

googledrivesync.exe.description: Google Drive — syncs your Google Drive files to your PC.

telegram.exe.kill_impact: Safe — You go offline. Messages are saved on Telegram's servers.

thunderbird.exe.kill_impact: Safe — Closes email client. Emails being composed may be saved as drafts.

filezilla.exe.kill_impact: Safe — Active file transfers are interrupted.

putty.exe.description: PuTTY — SSH terminal for connecting to remote servers.
putty.exe.kill_impact: Safe — Disconnects from the remote server.

winscp.exe.kill_impact: Safe — Active file transfers are interrupted.

docker desktop.exe.description: Docker Desktop — runs and manages Docker containers (virtual app environments).
docker desktop.exe.kill_impact: CAUTION — All running Docker containers will stop.
docker desktop.exe.kill_warning: Stopping Docker Desktop will stop all running containers.

vmware.exe.description: VMware Workstation — runs virtual machines (full operating systems inside Windows).
vmware.exe.kill_impact: CAUTION — Running VMs may lose unsaved work. Suspend VMs first.
vmware.exe.kill_warning: VMs may be affected. Save VM state first.

virtualbox.exe.description: VirtualBox — runs virtual machines (similar to VMware, but free).
virtualbox.exe.kill_impact: CAUTION — Running VMs may lose unsaved work.

wsl.exe.description: Windows Subsystem for Linux — runs a Linux environment inside Windows.
wsl.exe.kill_impact: Safe — Linux environment shuts down. Reopen to restart.

systemsettingsbroker.exe.description: Bridges UWP app settings with the Windows system settings.
systemsettingsbroker.exe.kill_impact: Safe — Settings changes may not apply until restarted.

backgroundtaskhost.exe.description: Runs background tasks for Store apps — like live tile updates and notifications.
backgroundtaskhost.exe.kill_impact: Safe — App background tasks stop. They restart as needed.

compattelrunner.exe.description: Windows Telemetry — collects diagnostic data about your system for Microsoft.
compattelrunner.exe.kill_impact: Safe — Data collection stops. No impact on your experience.

musnotification.exe.description: Windows Update reminder — the popup that nags you to restart for updates.
musnotification.exe.kill_impact: Safe — The restart nag goes away (temporarily).

crashpad_handler.exe.description: Crash reporter for Chrome-based apps — sends crash data to developers.
crashpad_handler.exe.kill_impact: Safe — Crash reports won't be sent. No other effect.

updater.exe.description: Auto-updater for an application — checking for or downloading updates.
updater.exe.kill_impact: Safe — That app's update check stops.

searchapp.exe.description: Windows Search app — the search UI in the taskbar.
searchapp.exe.kill_impact: Safe — Search bar stops working temporarily. Restarts automatically.

searchui.exe.description: Windows Search UI — the search interface in the taskbar (older Windows 10 name).
searchui.exe.kill_impact: Safe — Search stops briefly, then restarts.

searchprotocolhost.exe.description: Search Protocol Host — helps Windows Search access and index different file types.
searchprotocolhost.exe.kill_impact: Safe — Search indexing pauses. Restarts on its own.

searchfilterhost.exe.description: Search Filter Host — processes file content so Windows Search can search inside documents.

sppextcomobj.exe.description: Software Protection Platform — verifies your Windows license is valid.
sppextcomobj.exe.kill_impact: Safe — License check stops. Windows may re-check later.

wermgr.exe.description: Windows Error Reporting Manager — collects and sends crash/error reports.
wermgr.exe.kill_impact: Safe — Error reports aren't sent. No other impact.

prevhost.exe.description: Preview Handler Host — generates file previews in File Explorer's preview pane.
prevhost.exe.kill_impact: Safe — File previews stop working in Explorer. Restarts as needed.

rundll32.exe.description: Runs a function inside a DLL file — often used for Control Panel items and system tasks.
rundll32.exe.kill_impact: Safe — The specific system task it's running stops.

usoclient.exe.description: Update Session Orchestrator — manages the flow of Windows Updates.

microsoftedgeupdate.exe.description: Microsoft Edge auto-updater — checks for and installs Edge updates.
microsoftedgeupdate.exe.kill_impact: Safe — Edge update stops. Edge keeps working.

googleupdate.exe.description: Google Update — checks for updates for Chrome and other Google products.

googledrivefs.exe.description: Google Drive File Stream — mounts your Google Drive as a drive letter on your PC.
googledrivefs.exe.kill_impact: Safe — Google Drive virtual drive disappears. Local files unaffected.

officeclicktorun.exe.description: Microsoft Office Click-to-Run — manages Office installation and updates.
officeclicktorun.exe.kill_impact: Safe — Office update stops. Office apps keep working.

officec2rclient.exe.description: Microsoft Office update client — downloading or applying Office updates.

everything.exe.description: Everything Search — instant file search tool (much faster than Windows Search).

whatsapp.exe.description: WhatsApp Desktop — messaging app linked to your phone.
whatsapp.exe.kill_impact: Safe — You go offline on desktop. Messages still go to your phone.

signal.exe.kill_impact: Safe — You go offline on desktop.

cursor.exe.description: Cursor — AI-powered code editor based on VS Code.
cursor.exe.kill_impact: Safe — Closes the editor. Unsaved files usually recovered on relaunch.

rider64.exe.kill_impact: Safe — Closes the IDE. Save your work first.

idea64.exe.kill_impact: Safe — Closes the IDE. Save your work first.

pycharm64.exe.kill_impact: Safe — Closes the IDE. Save your work first.

sublime_text.exe.description: Sublime Text — fast, lightweight code editor.
sublime_text.exe.kill_impact: Safe — Closes editor. Hot exit usually preserves unsaved files.

dopus.exe.description: Directory Opus — advanced file manager (File Explorer alternative).

hwmonitor.exe.description: HWMonitor — shows CPU/GPU temperatures, fan speeds, and voltages.

cpuz.exe.description: CPU-Z — shows detailed CPU, memory, and motherboard information.

gpuz.exe.description: GPU-Z — shows detailed graphics card information and sensor data.

mstsc.exe.description: Remote Desktop Connection — connected to another computer remotely.
mstsc.exe.kill_impact: Safe — Disconnects from the remote computer. Work on remote PC is preserved.

mmc.exe.description: Microsoft Management Console — hosts admin tools like Device Manager, Disk Management, etc.

regedit.exe.description: Registry Editor — tool for viewing and editing the Windows Registry.
regedit.exe.kill_impact: Safe — Editor closes. Any unsaved changes are lost.

perfmon.exe.description: Performance Monitor — shows detailed performance counters and system diagnostics.

resmon.exe.description: Resource Monitor — shows detailed CPU, memory, disk, and network usage per process.

dxdiag.exe.description: DirectX Diagnostics — shows display, sound, and input device information.

lghub_agent.exe.description: Logitech G Hub Agent — background service for Logitech peripheral settings.
lghub_agent.exe.kill_impact: Safe — Logitech customizations may revert to defaults.

wallpaperengine32.exe.kill_impact: Safe — Animated wallpaper stops. Desktop goes to static wallpaper.

malwarebytes.exe.description: Malwarebytes — anti-malware protection running in the background.
malwarebytes.exe.kill_impact: CAUTION — Malware protection stops. You lose real-time scanning.

avgui.exe.description: AVG Antivirus — user interface for AVG protection.
avgui.exe.kill_impact: Safe — AVG UI closes but protection service usually keeps running.

avastui.exe.description: Avast Antivirus — user interface for Avast protection.
avastui.exe.kill_impact: Safe — Avast UI closes but protection service usually keeps running.

powertoys.exe.description: Microsoft PowerToys — collection of utility tools (FancyZones, PowerRename, etc.).
powertoys.exe.kill_impact: Safe — All PowerToys features stop (FancyZones, Color Picker, etc.).

autohotkey.exe.description: AutoHotkey — running a custom keyboard/mouse automation script.
autohotkey.exe.kill_impact: Safe — Custom hotkeys and macros stop working.

flux.exe.description: f.lux — adjusts screen color temperature at night to reduce eye strain.
flux.exe.kill_impact: Safe — Night mode color filter turns off.

sharex.exe.description: ShareX — screenshot and screen recording tool.

barrier.exe.description: Barrier — software KVM switch that lets you share keyboard/mouse between PCs.
barrier.exe.kill_impact: Safe — Keyboard/mouse sharing between PCs stops.

ssh-agent.exe.description: SSH Agent — stores your SSH keys in memory so you don't have to type passwords repeatedly.
ssh-agent.exe.kill_impact: Safe — You'll need to re-enter SSH key passwords for new connections.

gpg-agent.exe.description: GPG Agent — manages your GPG encryption keys.
gpg-agent.exe.kill_impact: Safe — GPG signing/encryption requires re-entering passphrase.
